intro: Copaiba bracteata, commonly known as the golden cupuaçu, is a tropical plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces a unique, aromatic resin that has been used traditionally for its medicinal properties. Its fruit, which resembles a cupuaçu, contains a sweet, creamy pulp and is valued in local cuisine. The species is also appreciated for its ornamental value due to its striking floral display.
